title: Quiz 1 - Adverbs
instruction: Read each sentence to find out whether there is any grammatical or idiomatic error in it. The error, if any, will be in one part of the sentence. The number of that part is the answer. If there is ‘No error’, the answer is (e).

quiz.text: A soldier is (a) taught never to (b) fight cowardly. (c) no error (d)
options: a
b
c
d

quiz.text: Tutankhamun's death mask is still(a) untarnished after the long(b) duration of four centuries so that(c) people know about the past art and culture.(d) No error (e)
options: a
b
c
d
e

quiz.text: Whenever you speak you(a) should speak with patiently and(b) confidently because it's your(c) responsibility to make your statement.(d) No error (e)
options: a
b
c
d
e

quiz.text: All the pupils (a)stood up respectively  (b) as the Guru entered the room (c) no error (d)
options: a
b
c
d

quiz.text: The technician reminded (a)them to have a thoroughly (b) cleaning of the machine(c) after each use.(d) No error (e)
options: a
b
c
d
e
